docs.summary: Provides functionality for elements that can be played.
Indicates if the element is currently playing.
description: To set the `isPlaying` property on an element, use the element's
[`play()`](#play) and [`pause()`](#pause) functions.
If you select **Autoplays on loading** in the element's Settings panel
in the Editor, the `isPlaying` property is set to `true` when the page loads.

examples.title: Get an element's current playing status
Toggle an element's current playing state

ret.doc: Fulfilled - The newly displayed image or slide.

description: The `next()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when the next
item is completely rendered. Calling `next()` when on the last item
moves to the first item.

examples.title: Move to the next item and log a message when done
body: console.log("Finished moving to the next item");

notes:
When using `next()` on a [gallery]($w.Gallery.html), make sure the
 [gallery]($w.Gallery.html) is one where the `isPlayable`
 [capability](#GalleryCapabilities) is `true`.

 If you [change a gallery's type](https://www.wix.com/support/html5/article/changing-the-gallery-type)
 to one that doesn't support `next()`, your code may no longer function correctly.

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the element is paused.

ret.doc: The gallery or slideshow that triggered the event.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when playback is paused.
description: An element can be paused by a user clicking the gallery or slideshow's
pause button or by calling its [`pause()`](#pause) function

examples.title: Get the ID of the element that has been paused

notes: When using `onPause()` on a [gallery]($w.Gallery.html), make sure the [gallery]($w.Gallery.html) is one where the `isPlayable` [capability](#GalleryCapabilities) is `true`. If you [change a gallery's type](https://www.wix.com/support/html5/article/changing-the-gallery-type) to one that doesn't support `onPause()`, your code may no longer function correctly. **Deprecation note:** The $w parameter of event handlers is being deprecated. To get a scoped selector for working with elements in repeater items, use the [$w.at()]($w.html#at) function and pass it the context property of the event parameter: `$item = $w.at(event.context)`. To learn more, see here.

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the element is played.

ret.doc: The gallery or slideshow that triggered the event.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when playback is started or restarted.
description: An element can be played by a user clicking the gallery or slideshow's
play button or by calling its [`play()`](#play) function.

examples.title: Get the ID of the element that is playing

notes:
When using `onPlay()` on a [gallery]($w.Gallery.html), make sure the
 [gallery]($w.Gallery.html) is one where the `isPlayable`
 [capability](#GalleryCapabilities) is `true`.

 If you [change a gallery's type](https://www.wix.com/support/html5/article/changing-the-gallery-type)
 to one that doesn't support `onPlay()`, your code may no longer function correctly.

**Deprecation note:** The $w parameter of event handlers is being deprecated. To get a scoped selector for working with elements in repeater items, use the [$w.at()]($w.html#at) function and pass it the context property of the event parameter: `$item = $w.at(event.context)`. To learn more, see here.

description: The `pause()` function pauses a slideshow or playable gallery and fires a `pause` event.
The `pause` event handlers set on this element by the [onPause( )](#onPause)
function or in the Editor are called.

examples.title: Toggle an element's current playing state

notes:
When using `pause()` on a [gallery]($w.Gallery.html), make sure the
 [gallery]($w.Gallery.html) is one where the `isPlayable`
 [capability](#GalleryCapabilities) is `true`.

 If you [change a gallery's type](https://www.wix.com/support/html5/article/changing-the-gallery-type)
 to one that doesn't support `pause()`, your code may no longer function correctly.

description: The `play()` function plays a slideshow or playable gallery and fires a `play` event.
The `play` event handlers set on this element by the [onPlay( )](#onPlay)
function or in the Editor are called.

examples.title: Toggle an element's current playing state

notes:
When using `play()` on a [gallery]($w.Gallery.html), make sure the
 [gallery]($w.Gallery.html) is one where the `isPlayable`
 [capability](#GalleryCapabilities) is `true`.

 If you [change a gallery's type](https://www.wix.com/support/html5/article/changing-the-gallery-type)
 to one that doesn't support `play()`, your code may no longer function correctly.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - The newly displayed image or slide.

docs.summary: Moves to the previous image or slide.
description: The `previous()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when the previous
image or slide is completely rendered. Calling `previous()` when on the first item
moves to the last item.

examples.title: Move to the previous item and log a message when done
body: console.log("Finished moving to the previous item");

notes:
When using `previous()` on a [gallery]($w.Gallery.html), make sure the
 [gallery]($w.Gallery.html) is one where the `isPlayable`
 [capability](#GalleryCapabilities) is `true`.

 If you [change a gallery's type](https://www.wix.com/support/html5/article/changing-the-gallery-type)
 to one that doesn't support `previous()`, your code may no longer function correctly.
